discussion.title: Plotting the Model
discussion.body:
After running the code, and getting a model that satisfies my demands, I'm trying to create a code that after running the SR completely, automatically plots my model, however the model is in a different language than python. Is there any way to do this automatically?

Ex: The code gave me the following model with "print(model.sympy())"

"(((20.633257470306607 - tan(cos((20.954950555333898 + ((0.3653416772988837 - (-0.05811945565811366 * cos2(-20.660016915422887 * x0))) - (-0.05811945565811366 * cos2(-20.660016915422887 * x0)))) / exp(x0)) / cube(sqrt(1.0459393285106797)))) / (-755.9790299821428 - tan(square(1.1824902973257656 - (sin((x0 + x0) + x0) + -0.04519784616746775))))) - 20.633257470306607)"

how could i automaticaly plot this function with matplotlib?

(New to programming and GitHub, if I made any mistakes let me know.)

nodes.body:
Hey @Aldirzaum, welcome! Happy to hear you are trying out PySR.

There is an example with plotting here: https://astroautomata.com/PySR/examples/#4-plotting-an-expression. Let me know if this works for you.

Cheers,
Miles
